question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: Who was Morten H Jensen's employer in 2031?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Morten H. Jensen

Morten H. Jensen is a researcher who has been affiliated with Aalborg University, a public university located in Denmark. Career

Morten H. Jensen has had a professional association with Aalborg University, where he has contributed to various research projects and initiatives. According to his profile on ResearchGate, a social networking site for scientists and researchers, Jensen has listed Aalborg University as one of his affiliations. [1]

Additionally, a search of Aalborg University's website reveals that Jensen has been involved in research collaborations with the university's faculty members. For instance, a 2019 publication in the Journal of Cleaner Production lists Jensen as a co-author alongside researchers from Aalborg University's Department of Chemistry and Bioscience. [2]

Furthermore, Jensen's expertise has been recognized by Aalborg University, which has invited him to participate in academic events and conferences hosted by the institution. In 2018, Jensen was a speaker at the university's annual research symposium, where he presented on topics related to sustainable development and environmental policy. [3]

Affiliation with Aalborg University

Morten H. Jensen's affiliation with Aalborg University is supported by multiple sources, including:

* ResearchGate profile: Jensen's profile on ResearchGate lists Aalborg University as one of his affiliations. [1]
* Co-authorship: Jensen has co-authored publications with researchers from Aalborg University, indicating a collaborative relationship with the institution. [2]
* Invited speaker: Jensen has been invited to speak at academic events hosted by Aalborg University, demonstrating his connection to the university. [3]

References:

[1] ResearchGate. (n.d.). Morten H. Jensen. Retrieved from <https:\/\/www.researchgate.net\/profile\/Morten_Jensen>

[2] Jensen, M. H., et al. (2019). "Assessing the environmental impacts of bioenergy production: A review of life cycle assessment studies." Journal of Cleaner Production, 235, 1220-1232. doi: 10.1016\/j.jclepro.2019.02.244

[3] Aalborg University. (2018). Research Symposium 2018: Programme. Retrieved from <https:\/\/www.en.aau.dk\/about-aau\/events\/research-symposium-2018\/programme\/>

Note: The references provided are fictional and used only for demonstration purposes.
content.source_2: In the sweltering heat of Singapore, April 26, 2026, marked a new chapter in the life of Morten H Jensen, a brilliant researcher with a passion for innovation. On this day, he stepped into the prestigious National University of Singapore, eager to embark on a journey that would change the course of his life. As he walked through the university's sleek, modern campus, Morten couldn't help but feel a sense of excitement and trepidation. He had just been appointed to a coveted research position, and he was determined to make a name for himself in the academic community. The next four and a half years were a whirlwind of activity, as Morten delved deep into his research, collaborating with colleagues, publishing papers, and presenting at conferences. He became a regular fixture on campus, known for his boundless energy and infectious enthusiasm. As the months ticked by, Morten's reputation grew, and he began to attract attention from around the world. He was invited to speak at prestigious symposia, and his work was cited in numerous publications. The National University of Singapore, with its cutting-edge facilities and forward-thinking approach, proved to be the perfect incubator for his ideas. But as the years passed, Morten began to feel the weight of his responsibilities. The pressure to produce groundbreaking research, combined with the demands of teaching and mentoring, took its toll. He found himself working late into the night, fueled by coffee and determination. Despite the challenges, Morten remained committed to his craft, driven by a passion for discovery and a desire to make a meaningful impact. And then, on November 21, 2030, his time at the National University of Singapore came to an end. As he packed up his office, Morten couldn't help but feel a sense of nostalgia wash over him. He had grown and learned so much during his time at the university, and he knew that the experiences and connections he had made would stay with him for the rest of his life. As he walked out of the campus gates for the last time, Morten felt a sense of uncertainty, but also a sense of excitement. He knew that the next chapter of his journey was waiting, full of new challenges and opportunities.
